name: stan
description:
Module Overview

This module provides the capability to connect with NATS Streaming server and performs the below functionalities.

  • Point to point communication (Queues)
  • Pub/Sub (Topics)
  • Request/Reply

Basic Usage

Setting up the connection

First step is setting up the connection with the NATS Streaming server. The following ways can be used to connect to a NATS Streaming server.

  1. Connect to a server using the URL
stan:Client newClient = new("nats://localhost:4222");
  1. Connect to one or more servers with a custom configuration
stan:Client newClient = new({"nats://serverone:4222", "nats://servertwo:4222"},  config);

Publishing messages

Publishing messages is handled differently in the NATS Basic server and Streaming server. The 'ballerina/nats' module provides different APIs to publish messages to NATS Streaming server.

Publishing messages to the NATS Streaming server

Once connected, publishing is accomplished via one of the below two methods.

  1. Publish with the subject and the message content.
string message = "hello world";
stan:Error? result = producer->publish(subject, message.toBytes());

Listening to incoming messages

Listening to messages from a Streaming server
// Initializes the NATS Streaming listener.
listener stan:Listener subscription = new;

// Binds the consumer to listen to the messages published to the 'demo' subject.
@stan:ServiceConfig {
    subject: "demo"
}
service demo on subscription {

    resource function onMessage(stan:Message msg, stan:Caller caller) {
    }


}

Note: The default thread pool size used in Ballerina is the number of processors available * 2. You can configure the thread pool size by using the BALLERINA_MAX_POOL_SIZE environment variable.

For information on the operations, which you can perform with this module, see the below Functions.

For examples on the usage of the connector, see the following.

  • Basic Streaming Publisher and Subscriber Example
  • Streaming Publisher and Subscriber With Data Binding Example
  • Durable Subscriptions Example
  • Queue Groups Example
  • Historical Message Replay Example

fields.name: subject
fields.description: Name of the subject to which it is subscribed to

fields.name: queueGroup
fields.description: The name of the queue group to which the subscription belongs to

fields.name: durableName
fields.description: If set, this will survive client restarts

fields.name: maxInFlight
fields.description: The number of messages the cluster will have in-flight without an ACK

fields.name: ackWaitInSeconds
fields.description: The time (in seconds) the cluster will wait for an ACK for a given message

fields.name: subscriptionTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: The time (in seconds) the subscription will wait if a network failure occurs during the creation of it

fields.name: autoAck
fields.description: if false, should manually ack the message

records.name: ServiceConfigData
records.description: The configurations for the NATS streaming subscription.

fields.name: subject
fields.description: The subject to which the message was sent to

records.name: Message
records.description: Represents the message, which a NATS server sends to its subscribed services.

fields.name: ackTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Timeout (in seconds) to wait for an acknowledgement for the corresponding subscription

fields.name: connectionTimeoutInSeconds
fields.description: Timeout (in seconds) to wait for a connection

fields.name: maxPubAcksInFlight
fields.description: The maximum number of published ACKs that may be in flight at any point of time

fields.name: pingIntervalInMinutes
fields.description: The interval (in minutes) between the attempts of pinging the server

fields.name: enableErrorListener
fields.description: Enables the connection to the error listener

records.name: StreamingConfig
records.description: Configuration related to establishing a streaming connection.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URL as a string array.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster configured in the NATS server

returnParameters.description: () or else a stan:Error if unable to complete the close operation.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URL as a string array.

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster configured in the NATS server

returnParameters.description: () or else a stan:Error if unable to complete the close operation.

clients.name: Client
clients.description: The streaming client provides the capability to publish messages to the NATS streaming server.

returnParameters.description: () or else a nats:Error upon failure to register the listener

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URL as a string array.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the client. The clientId should be unique across all the subscriptions. Therefore, multilpe subscription services cannot be bound to a single listener

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster configured in the NATS server. The default value is test-cluster

returnParameters.description: () or else a nats:Error upon failure to register the listener
() or else a nats:Error upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description: Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the nats:Listener.

returnParameters.description: () or else a nats:Error upon failure to start the listener
() or else a nats:Error upon failure to stop the listener
() or else a nats:Error upon failure to stop the listener

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The NATS Broker URL. For a clustered use case, pass the URL as a string array.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the client. The clientId should be unique across all the subscriptions. Therefore, multilpe subscription services cannot be bound to a single listener

parameters.name: clusterId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the cluster configured in the NATS server. The default value is test-cluster

returnParameters.description: () or else a nats:Error upon failure to detach the service

otherMethods.name: detach
otherMethods.description: Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the nats:Listener.

returnParameters.description: () or else a nats:Error upon failure to start the listener
() or else a nats:Error upon failure to stop the listener
() or else a nats:Error upon failure to stop the listener

listeners.name: Listener
listeners.description: Represents the NATS streaming server connection to which a subscription service should be bound in order to receive messages of the corresponding subscription.

constants.name: NEW_ONLY
constants.description: Specifies that message delivery should start with the messages, which are published after the subscription is created.

constants.name: LAST_RECEIVED
constants.description: Specifies that message delivery should start with the last (most recent) message stored for this subject.

constants.name: FIRST
constants.description: Specifies that message delivery should begin with the oldest available message for this subject.

annotations.name: ServiceConfig
annotations.description: The annotation, which is used to configure the streaming subscription.

types.name: TimeDeltaStart
types.description: Specifies that message delivery should start with a given historical time delta (from now).

types.name: SequenceNumber
types.description: Specifies that message delivery should start at the given sequence number.

types.name: StartPosition
types.description: Specifies the position to start receiving messages.

types.name: Error
types.description: The union of the NATS module related errors.
